articles.content:
Greetings to Vietnamese President 
    Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Tran Duc Luong, President of Vietnam, on Sunday on the occasion of the 57th birthday of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam.
 The message noted that over the past years the Vietnamese people achieved great successes in the struggle for the national independence, reunification and socialism under the leadership of the Communist Party of Vietnam.    
 Expressing belief that the traditional ties of friendship and cooperation between the two countries provided by the preceding leaders would invariably grow stronger in the future, it sincerely wished the president and people of Vietnam greater success in their work to build prosperous, socialist Vietnam true to the behest of President Ho Chi Minh.

articles.title: Greetings to senior Vietnamese officials
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam greets Slovak President 
    Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to President Rudolf Schuster on Sunday on the occasion of the day of the constitution of the Republic of Slovakia.
 In the belief that the ties of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would develop in various fields, Kim in the message wished the president and people of Slovakia success in their work for prosperity of the country.

articles.content:
Greetings to senior officials of Slovakia 
    Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- Premier Hong Song Nam sent a message of greetings to Slovak prime minister Mikulas Dzurinda on the occasion of the day of the constitution of the Republic of Slovakia.
 The message expressed belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms in the interests of the two peoples.    
 Meanwhile, foreign minister Paek Nam Sun sent a message of greetings to his Slovak counterpart Eduard Kukan.

Floral basket to Kim Jong Il from Palestine
    Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il received a floral basket from Yasser Arafat, President of the state of Palestine, on the occasion of the 54th anniversary of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
 The floral basket was handed to an official concerned by Shaher Mohammed Abdlah, Palestinian Ambassador to the DPRK, on Monday.

articles.title: North side's delegation back from inter-Korean economic meeting
articles.content:
Credentials to Kim Yong Nam from Indian Ambassador
    Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from new Indian Ambassador to the DPRK Rich Pal Singh at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 Present there was Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of foreign affairs.    
 After receiving the credentials, the president had a talk with the ambassador.

North side's delegation back from inter-Korean economic meeting
    Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- The north side's delegation led by first vice-chairman of the State Planning Commission Pak Chang Ryon, north side's chairman of the north-south committee for the promotion of economic cooperation, arrived here on Monday after participating in the second meeting of the committee in Seoul.
 It was met at the airport by Ro Tu Chol, vice-chairman of the State Planning Commission, Jong Un Op, chairman of the federation of national economic cooperation, and officials concerned.
